I have been busy to attend the Year end Parties this year December
totally different from last year December
I have no time to clean up my house as a Year end Cleaning
In japan, once at the end of the year ,we give a thorough cleaning, 
even to the corners , to our  houses with gratirude and we clean out 
dust and stain during the old year
We cleanse the house and welcom the new year,that is,  the New
Year Gods
We change stream of air fresh around the house
Good atmosphere and good aura charm good and lucky  gods
My died grandmother was a lady who had been born in 1899 , Meiji 
While hearing to ringing 108 times of New Year's Eve Bell, she gets the very first water from the tab to a cup ,and she serves it on the middle of the \"butudan” where is the highest place in the house for her 
After in the morning, she makes each of  us,grandchildren, drink a
mouthful of it , which she calls \"the very first water of the year
For me ,a little child ,that tepid water was even not a thankful thing
However even now it becomes the precious memory
It makes me remember the affection of my grandmother for families 
and the meaning of coming New Year
Do Cleaning up
Tomorrow is the day of putting in an appearance to show our skills in
learning sign language
I made sentences about Helen Keller who had been born as a blind, a 
deaf and a dump
I wonder how she learned that there was an each  word or an each 
name which represented for all the things that she had never seen 
How could she understand the sun and the moon
But I heard that she had even known the abstract words, such as
God who has no visible body and love that can be hard to understand
Every year I write them after I received others' ones
Almost two-third of people giving greeting cards whom I haven't seen 
During the begining  of the year ,we greet each other \"a happy new
Though we haven't meet for a long time ,it is a little bit odd to write 
that please go well with me as well as last year in the greeting card
in Kansai area
In Kanto area it is until Jan
We throw away decorations made of pine tree called \"matu-kazari
We celebrate New Year by welcoming  New Year's Gods at \"大正月
New Year's God  visit our houses by finding pine tree and go into the 
houses and stay beside \"kagami-mochi
We put \"kagami-mochi\" on \"Toko no ma\" where is the  most holly
If it is busy inside the house they will go away, so during three days 
of begining new year ,Jan 1st to 3rd., we housewives don't cook in the 
Each of \"Osechi\" dishes has a meaning  to hope happy life like 
to live  long to have many children  to have a lot of harvest ,etc
In Japan we count our age to add one year when a New Year comes
The ordinary age is called \" 満年齢(mannenrei）\",and we gains one 
Several decade ago, people who worked as a servant to live in the 
shop with owner merchant and his family  could take holiday after 
ending  New Year's period
They return to their hometown where their parents live
It means to go back to the counrty apart from the city
Their holidays are only two days per a year 
On now ,it is forbidden against the law of working rule
We asked the teacher who invented the keyboard
Was it invented by Bill Gates?\"(We also know that is not
A week later ,in the next lesson ,she gave us a paper in which the
story of typewriter being born was written 
typewriter but he sold the right soon to Mr
Densmore made an steady effort to sell the device and finally got  skyrocketed sales
There was also a sentence as following
keys for letters commonly used together to slow down typing to solve the jamming problem
However , when I read that sentence there ,it was not my\" time\" to 
know the alphabets' order on the keyboard is not related to the
frequency of each letter used in English language
I asked her how their salesmen had sold the machines one door to 
another 
I would just try  to make sure whether everyone in US knows this 
story which I had gotten  somewhere and sometimes in my life
I told her that they had explained how to use the machine with one 
word ,and asked her what the word was
We felt a sense of victory in front of defeated teacher
That is why this diarie's title is \"Typewriter\" 
The one special word is typewriter, of which letters are placed on the 
It had been maybe by chance, but it is enough for me to abandon my
After this, the revenge of our teacher had begun about Christmas☆
Recently we talked about the alphabets in English conversation class
Our teacher prepared us the game ,which was to guess the hidding 
words in the sentence and to fill in the blanks
Of course ,my  first suggesting letter is \"e\" 
It is because I have heard that the most frequent using letter in 
English is \"e\" when I was in high school
And maybe the second frequent using word is \"t
I have no confidence because I forgot that my high school teacher 
said  what the second letter had been 
Is it true that there is a  frequency order in alphbets
There is another reason that I choose  the next letter \"t
Why I think so because these \"e\"and \"t \"are settled in the first line 
on the keybord 
And we use our two fingers of left hand,middle finger for \"e\"and 
pointer for \"t
It is more easier  for us to use these two fingers than other two
little  finger and ring finger
Therefore ,\"before the some time\", I thought that the alphabets' order 
on the keyboard is based on the frequency of each letter using
The next word is \"g
There must be \"o\"and \"d\"（＾ｕ＾）
We guessed
After  finishing  3 more games , we won all the games easily
It depends on that other sentences ,which she also prepared for us, 
included full of love and the Bible words
At last the teacher asked us what is the most frequent using word in 
We got confused because we had never think about it before now
Maybe~\"あ\"？？？
We felt a sense of defeat in front of the teacher triumphantly

Today I was lectured by the professor of Virus at the university
The virus of cold only can combine with the cell of throat and gets into 
human's body
That is, if we swallow or eat the virus of cold, it could not get into the 
body throught the cell of the gullet or the wall of the stomach
So it is very effective that we  block the virus at  the throat and prevent
it from going into the inside
Since now though I have been taught the effect of gargling, I could not 
But when I feel something wrong at my throat, early taking medicine
I wish I could have known this before long
Last Friday at English conversation class,  we talked about tetanus
vaccination with our teacher from Colorado state
She told us children had been vaccinated it every 10 years in U
even after they grew up
In Japan we seldom take vaccinations after growing up
Her father made her take it because she often put off her shoes while 
If she was poked by a nail , there is a risk to become tetanus
While  hearing  her word \"poke\", we all wondered what was happened 
We can't hear the distinction of two
One is a top of the finger and  the other is an iron stick
We said there is no word which represents two different meanings by
same word in Japanese
We replied two words had different Kanji
In the next class I am going to correct it

The rule is very simple

You can play on the web for free (Japanese only

What I said in last diary entry are as follows
 But, a certain English speaker have an opposite opinion
And I received some opinions about it(thanks
I believe that any languages have strict rules, and we can write clear texts in any languages
In the same way, we can write poor writing in any languages
There are many text, which are hard to read and can be interpreted to multiple meaning, all over the world
So, both opinions \"The English language is logical\/illogical\" and \"The Japanese language is logical\/illogical\" are not correct
The important fact is usage of the languages
However, we might say that a certain language's feature urges people to write ambiguous sentences
But, my command of English is too poor to judge which language has this feature strongly, Japanese and English

Many Japanese believe that English language is much more logical than Japanese language
The reasons of it are following
However, I was surprised that a certain English speaker who has very good command of Japanese said \"my impression is opposite
That is to say, Japanese language is logical and have strict rule, English language is not logical
When someone begin to learn foreign language, first of all, he would study the \"rule\" of the language
And then, he would study simple sentences that follow the rule strictly, so he would think like this
He knows slang, illogical rule, incomprehensible expressions of his native language
He would always compare the language and his native language, and believe that the foreign language have strict rule, but his native language is not logical
This is the reason why someone who learn foreign language think his native language is not logical, I think
But, perhaps, he will recognize that the foreign language is as illogical as his native language is, when he master the foreign language

incomprehensible countable and uncountable nouns
Countable and uncountable nouns are basics of English grammar
But it is so hard to use these nouns properly for Japanese
Because the Japanese language doesn't have the concept that nouns are obviously countable or uncountable
Besides it seems that there are something differences about \"count\" between native English users and native Japanese users
Followings are example of mysteries
I can see that water, beer, information, advice are uncountable
First, I thought it's so easy to understand
it could be considered that objects which have not form are assigned to countable noun
But bread and meat are uncountable
Furthermore, furniture and baggage are uncountable
On the other hand, \"I have *a* headache.\" is a proper English sentence
I don't think we cannot count headache
I have ever had two headaches
I think I have to memorize each of primary English words is countable or not

My native language is Japanese, and I was often surprised at Japanese diary in Lang8
IMHO, although many diaries are manufactured by native Japanese speaker in SNS and blog every day, almost of those are useless except for oneself
However, diaries in Lang8 written by non-native Japanese speaker is much interesting
Of course, these diaries contain grammatical mistake due to written by non-native speaker, but there are more interesting than general diary written by native Japanese, I think
I think reasons of this phenomenon are following
 People who learn foreign language have desire to improve oneself
 So, there is a tendency that they have good writing skill(in one's native language
 Good logical structure of text is independent of language and common to the whole world

In fact, all the countries have it
Many reasons for people in each country need music
Firstly, people used musical to play for respect god or anything else that they respect; spirits, nature and etc., they thought song will make that satisfy and bless them to happy life
Although, we play it at church now
Next, music can influence people to enjoy and have energy, therefore musicians played it in events, festivals and parties
Finally, some music can relieve stress, so it is brought to heal and knows as music therapy, which can hear in hospital, school or home
In the other hand, music can divide in 2 parts; traditional music and international music
Traditional music is identify country music that people can know where are songs from
Unlike, international music is music that accepts all over the world
Some countries, traditional music is less play in present than the past and difficult to hear
In conclusions, we need music to play for respect Jesus, enjoy in events and therapy
In addition, we should to keep traditional music before it will lose because it is important due to it is identity in each country more than international music that can hear in many country
Today is Shrine of the city god parade day in my home town
Many people help this parade by walking and carrying city god statue to show around city for people can respect city god everywhere
The purpose of this day is respect city god who protect our town, it is belief in my home town
Shrine of the city god parade day is in every June and not specitfic day
In the evening of the day, it has fair
Many shops come to buy many things, and person who didn't respect city god will come in the evening
This fair has around 1 week

and waited a bus for 30 minutes, it was lately
Then I got on it and read my book but I was still bored because I sat on that bus 2 hours
It was more traffic jam
I waited another bus when I got off it
A bus came lately again
When the bus arrived, it has many people but I should go because I didn't know how long another bus come
Eventually, I arrived my home and took 3 hours and a half for come back home

tAlong with the development of the Internet, seldom people have the habit of keeping a diary
People often communicate with others through a variety of communication mediums, but they seldom have time staying alone thinking or writing
They forget one most important friend: themselves
How to be a loyal friend to yourself
Talk to yourself in your diary honestly
Prevention (1992, p.47) suggested 21 ways to staying up in down times
I read about old friends, and places that were once home for me, and often must read five or six times before I can recall them clearly.” Keeping our past in mind is important because I believe everyone values his\/her past life, or we do not need our memory and we will be like a piece of blank paper before die
When we read them several years later, we may recollect the houses we used to live in, the friends we used to be intimated with and the social environment at that time
The second thing we write on our diaries is our thoughts and feelings
It is fun when we look back our sort of childish thoughts when we were young
However we do not look down on them for we know that is how we have shaped our temperament now and maybe we will laugh at what we are thinking now in several years later
Then they chose  hot majors according to their parents’ suggestions and then attend universities, in which the same major’s students’ classes are also exactly the same no matter they like it or not
Those innate traits will not change throughout our life, thus we can be sure what career we should have in the future instead of following the current trend which probably not suit us

For example, if they can’t cut costs or lay off when they have poor results, they will go bankrupt
By contrast, When they have good performances, they will need more workers
In Japan, many large cooperatinos start to give up a lifetime employment system now because they begin to realize the system is irrational
Secondly, it is hard to maintain workers’ motivations when they are hired for their entire lives
If companies promise emplyees to be employed until the retirement age
In Japan,  the gorverment-managed railway comapany had reported a huge loss every year
In those days, it had ensured a lifetime employment
By contrast, they work hard if they have a possibility to be laid off
The Japan railway company has made big profits since it was privatized because employees have a probability to be fired and devote themselves to thier work

It's been so long since the last entry
Please think of it as a writing training
Here we go
I have no doubt I have a Japanese accent in English
I cannot but speak in that way whether or not I prefer it without magical trainings
Honestly, I don't want to be using such a strong accent that some people might not understand what I just said
Then, should I pursue a fluency in the Standard English
True, it is not waste of time to put my goal to become fluent in the language
However,  concentrating on one less significant thing about a language(at least for people unable to make themselves understood smoothly with it) just wears you out, especially when you are still not there in the language
Thus, I should rather put energy into gaining correct pronunciations which are legible to others

A typically case of using \"っ“, It's used when you want to say something verb as the past
For example 'いう'(means 'say') is present behavior, and if you want to say as not present but past, replace last character to 'た',  so 'いう' is converted to 'いた
In addition, sometimes add 'っ' before 'た', as a result it'll be 'いった
I'm not sure the rule when it should be added 'っ', but i guess that there is only way to remember pattern as each verb if it's added 'っ' like a English verb which can't have 'ed
Of course I'm not teacher so this might not be correct explanation

Nagoya castle is visited by almost visitors in my local town

Nagoya city has a lot of industry so you will be able to visit some of them
Especially I recommend you to visit Toyota that is largest automobile company all over the world that as you know
If you visit there you would be able to see a process of making cars and high technology industrial machines that the newest model 
It may be that you can get a mini-car of Toyota newest model
Moreover, not far from there you can find the Toyota museum that has historical automobile collection of Toyota and some advertisement items they have used
Other interesting place are a Nagoya port aquarium, which you can see big killer whale and some mammal animals

Nowaday, it has become common sense to think that everyone should have access to the higher level of education
Most of the modern societies are defending the idea of equality of chance
Indeed, long time education has been exclusively reserved for the upper social classes but things have changed
College or university give you the opportunity to access to knowledge among highly educated professors
Studies are a difficult path but if you go all the way you will be rewarded

Social welfare is a social system that the country or society generally provide all citizens with financial support and concession services in household, public health, environment protection and fundamental education sectors by law and polices
1.\tWelfare that meets the need of living and security such as household welfare, life support welfare and health care welfare
2.\tWelfare that meets the need of respect and enjoyment such as establishing supporting facilities that suit the lives and activities of the old people, developing mass culture, sports and recreation for them, enriching their spiritual life of and providing them with concessions and care in sight seeing, touring and using public transportations

Affective of the Earth Quake
In 2011.3.11
We got the Japanese Northeastern Pacific Ocean earthquake
This earth quake is one of the biggest earth quake ever,then that damages are so serious too
I guess everyone know this big news, but almost all people can't imagine what is going on at Japan
So I want to explain about these from now
First, It is a food problem
Some of the victim can't get enough food because rodes were broken by earth quake and tunami and absolute amount of food is too low for all of victims
Of cause Japanese government and other organization are tring to food supply, but it is difficult because of for these reasons
This story will tell you how Misery are victims.\"One day a man could get these food for a day, half of bread and half of rice ball
Second problem is a radioactive
This problem's news is bigger than earth quake's dameges for people
Nuclear power plant were given damage by earth quake and tunami
So radioactive are comming everywhere
Japanese government and Japan Self-Defense Forces are tring to reduce damage of radioactive
Specifically, they were watering to cooling pool of the nuclear power plant to cooling down
Now,Nuclear power plant's crisis is almost over,but at that time people thought this crisis is return of the chernobyl
It is an electrical problems
Remember,Nuclear power plant is a power plant for Fukushima that is the place there were given the biggest damage by earth quake and tunami
So around that place are black outing
However they need electrical right now
But of cause it is impossible
So Japanese government uses \"plan blackouts
It means Tokyo has some blakouts few times in some days
It is so inconvenience
But they are patiencing for earthquakes victims
These are what's going on in Japan right now

In a few corrections are welcome
His works have had a huge effect on old Japanese society
His works and thoughts are effecting today's Japanese society also
If he didn't wrote these works, Japanese society is different from now
So we should know about him
He was born as a lower class samurai's son around Osaka on January, 10, 1835
When he was three years old, he was adopted by his uncle because his father was died
He started to learn Chinese classical literature When he was fourteen years old because it was an accomplishment for a samurai
It is said that he was very good at that
At that time, the Japanese Government practiced national isolation, it means no import and no export with other countries
But the Netherlands and China are only countries that were excepted from the rule
So, Japanese scholars studied Dutch at that time
Then he became the chairman in that school
In 1858, he built the school that is now \"Keio University\" to teach Dutch studies, 
but he noticed that Dutch studies couldn't help to learn about Western culture and style
So he started to study English by himself to learn and teach about Western culture and style
By 1867, he sold his Japanese sword to go to America again
Later in life, he wrote many books for society and people, Then he died on February, 3, 1901
Among them, these three books,\"Things western\", \"Encouragement of  learning\" and \"An Outline of a Theory of Civilization\" given greatly affected society
The first book is \"Things western
This book is made up of 10 books
At that time, very few Japanese people knew about the western culture, style, and things
The people of that time read these books, and they could learn about western style and different the Japanese style was
These books were  200,000 copies
This amount is very large number for Japan at that time
The second book is \"Encouragement of  learning
This book is made up of 17 books
These books outline the meaning of study and how it should be done
In those days, Japanese study is too confusing and too complex for normal people
So, he share his ideas about how to study on these books
His idea is \"Study should be more simple and more efficient.\" 
So these books were very good to tell anything for normal people
Then some part of these books are used in Japanese textbooks
All Japanese people know this phrase,\"天は人の上に人を造らず人の下に人を造らず。
Its meaning is this,\"Heaven doesn't make a man better than others, nor does it make a man worse than others.\" 
Almost all American heard this phrase, Because this phrase came from The Declaration of Independence of the United States of America
These books were 3,000,000 copies
This number is amazing, because in those days the Japanese population was only 30,000,000
It mean 1\/10 of Japanese people read these books
The last book is \"An Outline of a theory of Civilization
This book made up of 10 books
These books were written on 1875
These books outline is about civilization
In these books, he said that civilization's true nature is human companionship and Coexistence with any kind of elements
These ideas were the basis of those days idea of civilization
These books were not the best sellers, but they are evaluated by today's scholar
So we can say his works and thinking greatly affected Japanese society
If you want to increase your knowledge, you should read his works once

Fukuzawa Yukichi, He is one of the most famous author in Japan and one of the most respected person too
His works given huge affect at old Japanese society
His works and thought are giving affect to today's Japanese society also
His words are often quoted by speech
So I want to introduce him from now
He was born as a lower class samurai's son in around Osaka at January, 10, 1835
When he was three years old, he was adopted by his uncle because of his father was dead
He started to learn Chinese classical literature When he was fourteen years old because it is an accomplishment for samurai
When he was twenty first years old, he started to go to the most famous Dutch studies school in Japan at that time
At that time, Japanese Government did national isolation, but Dutch and China are only country of out of example
So Japanese scholar studied Dutch at that time
Then he was be the chairman in that school
At 1858, He build school it is an origin \"Keio University\" to teach Dutch studies
But he noticed Dutch studies can't help to study about Western culture and style
On the 1860, he was chosen to American envoy's member
Next year ,he was chosen to Europe envoy's member
Besides on 1867, he solve his Japanese sword to go to America again
After these, he otherwise scout from Japanese new government, he focused on his school management it was changed to learn English studies
After his life, he wrote many books for society and people, Then he dead at February, 3, 1901
His literary works are often knows, and his books and thought given very big affect to Japanese society
Among them, these three books,\"Things western\", \"Encouragement of  learning\" and \"An Outline of a Theory of civilization given\" given huge affect to society
So I would explain about these three books
First one is \"Things western
This book made up of 10 books
These books were written on 1866-1870 when he came back to Japan each times
These books outline are the culture, style, and things in western countries
At that time, almost all Japanese people doesn't know about the western culture, style, and things
So he wrote these books to explain western style's Politics, tax system, bonds, companies, diplomatic, military, science, technology, school, newspaper, library, hospital, museum, steam engine, telegraph, and gas lamps
The people of that time read these books, and they could know western style and how late Japanese are
These books were  200'000 sold
This number is so big number for old Japan
Second one is \"Encouragement of  learning
This book made up of 17 books
These books were written on 1872-1876
These books outline are what is study's meaning and how should be study
At those days, Japanese study is too confusing and too complexity for normal people
So he shows his idea about how should be study on these books
His idea is like this, \"Study should be more simply and more efficient.\" So he used plain writing on these books, but his idea on these books were great, then some part of these books are used to Japanese textbook
All of Japanese people know this phrase,\"天は人の上に人を造らず人の下に人を造らず。
 It meaning is this,\"Heaven dosen't make a man better than others, nor does it make a man worse than others.\" Probably you know this phrase
This phrase came from The Unanimous Declaration of the United States of America
This phrase was used on the first sentences of the Encouragement of learning
These books were 3'000'000 sold
Because at those day's Japanese population is only 30'000'000
Last one is \"An Outline of a theory of Civilization
This book made up of 10 books
These books was written on 1875
These books outline are what is civilization
In these books, he said civilization's true nature are Human companionship and Coexistence with any kind of elements
These idea was be basis of those days idea of civilization
These books were not the best seller, but these books are being evaluated by today's scholar
As mentioned earlier, his works gave huge affects to Japanese people, scholar, thinker, and Government
A lot of thinker were from his school, a lot of great government officer are his friends or his students
So I can say his works and thinking gave huge affects for Japanese society
He has great talents
Then he could gave huge affects to Japanese society
So still he was prised by us

And ￥10'000 bill is the most expensive bill in Japan
It means he is one of the respectful person in Japan

去年Startrackが開封してからしばらくして,私わこの映画を見たいという思いがしました。
友達に一緒に見て行かないのと問いました。
ところが皆ことわりました。
面白くないと見えて見ました。
やむなく一人でも見ようと心だって上映のせんーしゅうらく映画館に行きました。
コカコーラを買って映画観に入場したからわたし一人だけでした。
そのりょうりょう
最初は私の映画観をもていたのそうにおもしろいかたです。
それでも時間が経てば経つほど気味があやしかたです。
突然鬼神でも出現すれそうに。
結局映画が終わるまで怖い心で見ました
今考えて見ればとても面白いけいけんでした。
わたしがいつまたこの大きい映画館で一人映画を見られますか？

This game teach individuals on how to engage enemies, what items are needed for each heroes, which skills to be used first and ways on how to be the first to kill
If the person is a beginner or a first-time player, they need to get use with every heroes before they know what every heroes need and how to use every type of hero
Before killing their opponents, each player needs to know the basics which is farming
The word \"farming\" or \"creeping\" is use when each player kills a creep and when they kill every creeps, the player will receive a huge amount of gold
Besides that, the player will also automatically \"level up\" and when they level up, the player will be able to get upgrade their skills
After the player has earn as much as they have, they can build their items and then engage their enemies when it is the right time to do so
But each players also need to be careful in engaging their enemies, as their opponents will not be that simple as the creeps are
Each players must have a balanced of using both items and skills in the battle
When comes to teamwork, the team must be aggressive, have great confidence, and also to know their opponent well

Business-Model
We have decided to change our business-model to the new one without a selling function
to consumers
In this case, we are afraid that any writer will not feel it attractive because we
hold no data of the consumers
So, we will have to add anew a strong-point to it
Plan1
To produce well the person who has a lot of valuable information but is not good at spreading
his to the society
The problem of the plan1

I first went to the Heian-jingu shine at Night
There are many sightseer from several country including Japan in this area
The Heian-jingu shine was built in the 19th century to prise the virtue of two emperor
The year when the buildings of this shine were completed had been just 1100th since the old capital of Kyoto was founded
One is the first emperor, Kanmu, who first opened Kyoto city, and the other is the last emperor, Komei, who based in Kyoto
The building in the Heian-jingu shine is replica of the imperial palece in Kyoto city in the 8th century
In this conference, I got knowledge to improve of my study
The Eikando-temple is holding the special night visits in this season
The Eikando-temple is one of the most famouse temple and garden
I like moving around Kyoto city at night, because there are not many people in the city
At night, you can see different sight from the daytime
If you come to Kyoto, I want you to walk around the city at night
There are not any problem on the security in Japan, but you can not ask anyone where you are if you are strange
I don't have the event to write in this site every day
Kyoto is an old capital in Japan and has many traditional buildings,such as temple and shrine, including seventeen sites of the Unesco world heritage
I will write about Higashiyama area in Kyoto next time

Cabinet has not found the ideal solution to this problem yet
But the deadline is by end of the month in May according to the agreement Japanese and U

I wonder how foreign people see Japan's peaceful constitution
Our constitution was actually imposed by the country which occupied our country from 1945 to 1952, the United States of America, on us, and suprisingly It has never been revised since then
Because Article 9th in our constitution prohibits our troops, Self-Defence Forces, from being dispatched to battle fields, the troops had never taken part in the wars till the end of the Gulf war
Well, in a strict sense, the existence of SDF in itself is actually the violation of Article 9th, but for the sake of simplicity let's put it aside for now
During the Gulf war, because we were not able to dispatch the SDF to Kwait, we assisted Kwait and the international force with a plenty of money, more than 13 billion dollars
However, this was regarded as the arrogant attitude, trying to solve every problem with money, and Japan was criticized from all over the world
After the end of the Gulf war, the news paper in Kwait listed the countries which assisted them on its paper, but there was no name of Japan.) 
From then, Japan became to think seriously about how they should contribute to the world
Nowadays, many politicians are moving on to revise the Constitution, especially Article 9th, so that the SDF will be able to be sent to battle fields
Actually, the number of citizens who demand the revision is also increasing too
The other is to remain as it is now, and be an exemplary country which pursues the world of non-violation
So I refrain from expressing my own opinion against this problem
I hope this essay helps you know the problem of the constitution in Japan
Do you know that windows in the buildings built long time ago, let's say 500 years ago, are thin at upside and thick at downside
However, these things are only the part of glass
In actuallity, the word \"glass\" is used in a more broad sense in a scientific world
The glass used in daily lives consists mainly of silica dioxide
By heating and melting a mixture of silica dioxide and accessory components, powder of metal components, you gain the liquid of it, and then by quenching it we obtain what we call \"glass
However, you should not recognize glass as a substance made up of silica dioxide
Actually, every kind of substance can be glass; even water can be glass too
The defenition of glass is \"the state of frozen-like liquid, which has randomly-disposed molecules.\" Be careful not confuse it with solid, which has regular molecular location
Anyway, as I mentioned above, glass is a state of frozen-like liquid, so it possesses the character of liquid

Finally, the doctor told his father that the only way to make the most of his death is to transplant his organs to other kids, the Israeli children

I-Phone
Yesterday, I bought an I-Phone, which I had wanted for so long
By actually using it, I am quite satisfied and surprised with its functionality
A brand new I-Phone doesn't contain a lot of functions, which is still far superior to other cell phones, but you can add as many applications as you want by downloading them from the Internet
The application which surprised me the most was Google searching system
With it, you can search any information on the internet without typing any word
The only thing you have to do is to say what you want to search into the mobile
This voice recognition system is so great that it can also recognize very complicated words
It even can recognize the words \"Maxwell Boltzman distribution\", which is a jargon in the field of chemistry
If you still don't have it, I strongly recommend you buy it
Of course, its monthly cost is a little bit higher than others, but it really deserves it

Nowadays everyone has a microwave oven in their home, and gains benefit from it
At first, do you know that microwave ovens can neither heat nor melt an ice
Microwave ovens are home electronics that can be utilized to heat food by exposing it to the microwaves which generate from the attached parts called \"Magnetron
this is because a water molecule is polarized, but I don't go further into it for the sake of simplicity.) This vibration causes frictions between the water molecules and the inside of foods, which results in the generation of heat, and of course this heat increases the temperature of food
I hope you could instinctively understand the system of microwave with this explanation
Actually the way I explained is not scientifically rigorous, but it doesn't make a big difference in the result
So now let's go back to the question written above, why ice cannot be heated by micro wave oven
High-class restaurant in Japan, which is often called \"Ryotei\", has experienced several hardships in this 20 years
The first hardship was the bursting of the bubble economy, which took place around 1990, and the second was the Lehman collapse
These incidents caused the decrease of their customers, but still they could continue to operate business due to politicians
Since the post-war economic growth period, Ryotei had been used by many politicians for faction meetings during an election and Cabinet formation
The change in administrations will be a big blow for them
Because the new administration, the Democratic Party, is very eager to reduce waste, the members of it are not likely to use expensive restaurants
Well, this would be really a tough time for Ryotei
Actually many of them has closed recently
In my opinion, it is the time for them to diversify their business
Maybe they should expand their customers to the average people, who couldn't visit Ryotei due to lack of money

Takeshima Territory problem
In 1952, the Korea president at the time, Rhee Syngman, declared that the ocean area including Takeshima belonged to Korea, and this was actually the start of this festering dispute between Japan and Korea
When the Japanese Education Ministry guidelines were announced in 2008, Korea responded strongly against this guidelines, because the guidelines said that there is a discrepancy between Japan and Korea regarding Takeshima
This story tells us the difficulty to solve this problem
This entry's aim is to let you know about Takeshima Territory problem and not to blame Korea

Today was the start of the later process in my university
When I was looking for classes which pique my interest, I found a very intriguing class
It was \"Esperanto-language course
Its grammatical system and vocabulary are mainly based on European languages, but many complicated things, such as the gender of noun, the indefinite article and so on, are eliminated from it
I especially found it helpful that there is no indefinite article in this language, because the concept of it is difficult for Japanese to grasp
Unfortunately, this language has not spread among people, so only few people can speak it
However, I, who is a little bit perverse, like studying something which is not popular and seems to be unuseful
I am planning to take a level four of the Esperanto Language Proficiency Test(ELPT) at the end of the year

As the development of the Internet technology, more and and more digital productions are widely used in people’s life
Such as mp3,  psp,  digital cameras
Those of things have improved our life’s quality
In my opinion, there are at least two effects that these productions give us
First and foremost, it is no doubt that the productions make our life more convenient
For example, we can listen to music everywhere by mp3
However, there are also some defections
For example, now many mobile phones have the e-book function, which we can read some books through the mobile phones
While the word size in it is very small
What’s more, fewer and fewer people use computers , instead of handwriting
I don’t think it is a good for our Chinese to promote our Chinese culture

SHOULD ONE EXPECT A REWARD WHEN DOING A GOOD DEED
Different people have different views about wether or not one should expect a reward after doing a good deed
There are two kinds of opinions about this
Some people consider that we ought to expect some rewards from others
After all, you help them from troubles
While the rest part of people think that we shouldn't get anything from others after doing someone's favour
Lei Feng was respected by them very much
If you do a few good things to others, you'd better not to expect to take some rewards from this
In my opinion, after doing a good deed,you'll feel very happy
Compared with rewarding, the feeling of happiness is more important 
If all of us can help each other, our society will be more civilization and harmonious

Two weeks ago,I've been felt heavy in the head
These days,I struggle to execute my art work,and I ponder what does it bring to people
From the beginning,DO PEPOLE DEMAND ART IN JAPAN
ANIME,GAME,MOVIE,MANGA,you know almost of them(exept movie) are industry we Japanese proud of
Ofcourse I love them,but
Japanese arts are for example,Nihonga,(Japanese-style painting),Ukiyoe(wood endraving),Chaki(teathings), Jiin(the architecture of temple and shrine),traditional architecture and citylandscape
These are all of crafts not Arts
These looks art,and why these was born and succed results from old Japanese general's favorite of beauty craft
And on the threshold of an age of peace -Edo period these luxury item transformed and popularized into math's life
Only Ukiyoe(Japanese printings) was born at Edo period
It is like Managa and poster,supposed by math
All of them are craft in life
And craft is in utilitarian objects made by the common people
Nowtoday,say to sad traditonal crafts are not in our life
People seek more convinient and comfortable products.(ummm
This subject is like textbook
On the other hand,modern art is not supposed by math in Japan
I'v worried about  majour worthiness of things in Japan
In this nation,people don't give weight to traditional culture,don't think to save heritage in our life
Companies want to multiply wearth,so produce too many wasted and  products
There is flooded with goods which is row quality,cheap,and not necessary to buy
I think to use one good product for long time,is very fine way in life
Where do we-Japanese will go
I lost what I should make
And there is many people who don't have phirosophy
They don't say 'no' by onself
They can say 'no' when the group's opinion is 'no
What is right,what is wrong, these thinking is not important for them
Only important thing is safety-first
Many Japanese are unwilling to make waves in community
However they are under a stress
So they like to complain in more small group or web
But don't move and raise their voice to change
I said myfriends my thinking and Japanese people's infantilism,they became sulkily and said 'That's the way it goes,I don't think it is much of a problem
What is community for?And why do they have franchise
I was tired of these things,and heaviness in my head grew more and more
I didn't want to see people,and I withdrawed into myself
In deeply mediation, I want to break this depressed state
And I thought do some relaxation exercise
At that time,my friend ask me to her friend has mauntain hut to skiing,so why don't you skiing for a bit of relaxation
The mountain is in Nagano,where was hold winter Olimpic cause the snow's good　condition and nearness to Tokyo
Under  clear blue sky,in pure atmosphere,I enjoyed skiing
I used full of my body and a part of blain  which were'nt used usually
And in the end of the day,my mind was washed somewhat
I love skii
Skii is the sports of dialogue with mountain,I think
Myself with ground
Listening in silence,talk to slope and snow
Harmonizing body with inclination,enjoy skiing full at fresh snow,have a good soak in beauty in wood
When you meet some wrong conditiion, bump of root,fields bare of snow,dip,you can change them into fun course where you can play tricks only in these situation
Get on,bound,and jump higher
Grasp condition of snow surface and inclination of slope,concentrate your attentiopn on the point between board and ground,and imagine the best balance of your weight and the world under your feet
To do like these is very impossible to skii
Get and imagine yourself as weight,pure and simple form of weight,objectively,and the consciousness in body-which changed mere object-will begin to slide on air
Feel so good,and the beautiful scenery came into your view like flash
When layer of Scenery beauty and comfortable lesponce from ground overlaped,you'd surely feel pleasant
Days went on so
Beautiful scenery and pleasant tiredness let me rest in peace
I went back to Tokyo
And now,I hope that I'll be able to see this town at new angle
And I decide to trip to Kyoto in this month to see how the society consits
Doing nothing but complaining brings me deep dipression,and nothing become change
I should take advantage of this ploblem to change and make it my work,and then draw people into my vision
As if I run on root of wood,avail it to try to turn and enjoy spin
I decide to execute my work more sharp and more strong to strike a cord in the heart of people

They are focus on  the Manga culture, and try to promote Japanese animated films, Manga and game software the news paper said the other day
The locatoin has yet to be decided but the agency is eyeing a spot in Odaiba

Oden is a Japanese winter dish consisting of several ingredients such as boiled eggs, daikon radish, konnyaku, and processed fish cakes stewed in a light which is called chikuwa, soy-flavoured dashi broth
You can find in the restaurant, supermarket, and even convinience store
I recommend you to have the Oden when you come to Japan in winter
This journal has some answer about kokujin posted
I answered to his question in my journal, Because I need someone's help to correct my English
kokujin's questions is blow
We hardly use it on our conversation
We often heard it the host said in the party
Because We can't understand \"証\" proves about
We ususally use this word with some word
We often use \"証拠\" if you are suspected that you did foul play by someone
These sentenses above is almost same meaning
We seldom use \"傍聴\" on our conversation
傍聴\" is usually used on the court(judge
Today, I got some questions about Japanese on the following sentence
I want to answer these questions, but I don't have much confidence what I wrote in English
But you should take care of using this sentence in your conversation
Because this sentence sometimes have a negative meaning
This has sometimes a negative meaning
but sometimes not
Because if you asked someone who admited himself that want to marry eagerly
In this case, this question that you asked does not have a negative meaning
On the contrary, if you asked someone who does not admited himself about that
It might has a negative meaning

Can people tuen evil? part.2
In addition, Zimbard’s study represents the abuse of prisoner at Abu Ghraib
There have not only power of authority but also power of group
The role donated guard and the prisoner, and they have great difference of the power and make contact closer more than Milligan’s experience
In consequence, the simulation led dependency each other and the ability control exercised by prisoner
In this way, people protect by pseudonym and do not have individual resuponsibility, there happen loss of awareness and bring deindiciduation
As a result, the people show more emotional, impulsive and irrationally action and they are easy to influence other people’s behavior and social phenomenon such as genocide, stereotyping, and disinhibitation
The many American military also protect by government and hide in the crowd
In conclusion, Zimbard and Milgram’s experiment certify human just act one’s own role faithfully, and depend authority and group
These problems often happened like school, daycare, and company
Human always can be turning evil
Since childhood, we must learn that do not punish weak and poor people, and should not kill someone though parents, teacher, and religion
However, our societystill have bullying, power harrasment and war
Why does it happen insistently
There have some cause of human characteristic
Milligram and Zimbard’s experiments, especially, is important because they make clear why people happened cruel matter like Auschwitz, and Abu Ghrab torture and prisoner abuse
First of all, the Milgram and Zimbardo’s experience prove people are effect easily by outside influence
Miligram and Adolf Eichnmann, who conduct massacre by Hitler, have same situation
For example, they work distance from the subject and are tasked particular role
As a result, they assume the action as one of tasks, and completely absorbed in the world
According to milligram, S
Moreover, even when the destructive effects of their work become patently clear and they are asked to carry out actions incompatible with fundamental standards of morality, relatively few people have the resources needed to resist authority.\"  
The point of view is no one doubt or feel wired about the situation
An Eichmann once insisted to just follow higher officer and escape from the crime
In conclusion, the hero’s behavior and the idea are mirror person’s live
He meet with blind man for the first time; thus, he acts like does not care or hate Robert
There have discrimination and preoccupations to handicapped people; nevertheless, they work together, and then the hero realizes the blindman’s ability
Even though he could not experience, the fact give element of surprise and makes close to them
We tend to like everything same and similarity; yet, when you encounter the something different, it would bring new view and world
I feel living foreign country means to confront discrimination
For example, my acquaintance who understand English was talked behind her back at subway
Also, aother person was threw stones from native children when he ride a bike, and my friends had experienced unwanted sexual conduct from home-stay familly and proffeser
In addition, it is not only Japanese but also other foreigner
Before, I took ESL (English second language);then, some Maxican insisted \"the native don't beliave us because the policeman often called to us to stop
In my case, it's no big deal than my friend, but I was not a little dissapointed because the country received many foreigner; therfore, I had though they are liberal
Of course, To go abroad is exciting and valuable things, but it sometimes makes me notice human dark side

but, there is nothing in the place where I live

It is the reader, young teen ager, or America
We often use “our”; yet, there have different target
“Cathedral”, there draw “our” life as person who is non- handicapped and “our” as disabled person

This situation is to be possible to occur, and  mirrors our lives

The hero’s attitude show how person have reationship with handicapped person in real world

There have two of causes and they tell how attractiveness is important
First of all, attractiveness key of character building
His study examined shows the subject pictures which are some variety of attractive children’s: bad, good, and neutral; then he ask them about the children’s character
As a result, the judgment become good as the looking is attractive, and become worse as children is non attractive
Also, Landy and Signal (1974) make students essay, and the subject evaluate essay which is attached their photo each of them
Although some essays are good and the others have error, the subjects tend to make good grade to attractive students
We judge whether person is good looking or not, and change aptitude without intention
These are one of the reason why attractive people are smart and intelligent, and a cause which they are often praised

11 macromineral include sodium, calusium, phosphorus, magnesium, potassium,sulfur, andchloride, and micromineral contain iron, zinc,manganes, copper, and iodine

To going unknown world experience everyone although there have big or small difference
It makes us fun, and we learn many lessons
“Araby” is source of the experience
The protagonist is teen ager and the story is written with his view
One day he goes to a baser instead of a friend’s sister who he likes, and tries to present for her; however, he faces obstacles in there
The author tell some theme and teaching though the character, and to enter the unknown world
First of all, to enter and expect unknown world lead too much confidence on oneself
The protagonist goes to baser, and promises to buy something for her
There has fact that he has liking for her, and she look enviously at him
These bring him a big responsibility and, have a chance to close her
Also, it lead image what baser wonderfully event
Moreover, the image becomes larger and larger automatically through her attitude and wards
The small hero is deeply in dream, and cannot find out the truth
In consequence, his disappointed is big when he arrived narby, and feel miserable darling go back home
These are happen many people too
In my case, many my friends are interested in America, and they make me to draw great world; thus, I expect everything different, and I can change completely by going to other country
However, it was just image because I hit the wall such as language and difference of culture as same as other international students
Also, many of them go back country due to mental illness
They think America is “cool”; yet, do not notice there are necessary a lot of effort
The author send message that looking forward something bring happy and feel more exciting, however too much expectation bring cause of estimation
Everyone goes into an unknown world although they have experience that differ either greatly or not so much
“Araby” is story about gaining experience
The protagonist is a teen ager, and the story is written from his point of view
One day, he goes to a bazaar in the place of a friend’s sister who he likes, and tries to buy a present for her; however, he faces obstacles in there
This brings him a great responsibility and, gives have a chance to get closer to her
Moreover, the image becomes larger and larger through her attitude and wards; then, the hero is deep in dream, and cannot find out the truth
Consequently, he is highly disappointed when he arrives Araby, and feels miserable going back home
In my case, many of my friends are interested in America, and they make me to imagine a great world; thus, I expect everything to be different, and I can change completely by going to another country
However, it was just an image because I hit the wall when it came to language and difference of culture same as other international students
They think America is “cool”; yet, do not notice it is necessary to put force a lot of effort
The author sends the message that looking forward to something brings happiness and make you feel more excited; however, too much expectation causes of disappointment
First example of the problem is his relatives
When he tells his aunt he is going to the baser, she looks at him suspiciously that he is be up to something, and the people around him, like teachers, also treat him strictly
Also, the protagonist keeps doing boring and simple work for Araby
However, there have things that cannot get over or nothing to do by one’s self
For instance, his uncle did not get go back home on time, and forgot that he was going to the bazaar.(page432
After that, he takes the train and gets started for the bazaar at last
He realized the journey has finished badly
People cannot control their own life and some time, hard working does not connect succeed
Finally, there are likely things that will not be understood if people do not experience it
Even though he made the tripe alone and he has a particular mission, he is just a child to outside world
It is emphasized she treated him coldly
The journey changes nothing and he goes back home being angry and sad
However, the facts, the merchants are Western people, the unknown world is nothing, and he did not know how small he was, did not know until he explored Araby
For better or worse, these experiences give a big impact to his own mind than the ones he hears from the other people and leave something as value

There did not have hierarchy, and did not people who were aggressive and wanting to fight
In Pueblo Bonito, the largest town at Chaco Canyon, the people lived in brick building which have 800 rooms and use 30000sandstone to build
There already existed religious and worship ceremonies place, KIVAS
The government control the society thought religious power
Their previous foods were from crop like bean, maize squash and the society was matriarchal
In contrast of Southwest, there has hierarchy, and the worship based on the system
The people were divided nobility, “great sun” and “nobleman”, and commoners, “stinkers”
Also, the tribes were aggressive and more war-like, and they lived in mound building with density populated

People tend to make judged based of their selves and if someone have lack of ability than them it become cause of discrimination

He said to make Robert embarrassed
He did not expect that Robert answer the question
Also, When Robert ask something to him, his answer is simple and he sais to the blind man flat down because he consider if he have a conversation to the blind man, Robert would not make sense what I talking about

The biggest reason of the act is that he has no idea the blind man notice it

5 saturated fat, which is found in animal source like meat, poultry, and dairy product, are solid at room temperature
It increase LDL; thus, saturated fat is known as unhealthy fat
The fat is made combination of carbon, oxygen and hydrogen that is fully saturated with carbonhydrate, and saturated compound are all single bond
In contrast, unsaturated fat, which are found in plant, and vegetable oil, are liquid at room temperature
The carbon- bond is double bond
It carries cholesterol from the liver to the body cell’s in the blood, however; LDL stick and do not move smoothly like HD
As a result, when too much cholesterol in the blood, it builds up in arteries and it cause of heart attack and atherosclerosis
The foods which include LDL are egg, batter, and beef
HDL is known as good cholesterol because it removes LDL cholesterol which is store in our body, and protect from heart disease
Also, HDLs move very comfortably though blood, therefore, they do not stuck in it

The benefits for owing pets
The people who own a cat, a dog, or other pet will agree that having pets makes them feel happy
In addition, now the scientists are starting to prove that there are benefits for owing pets
For example, the people with pets generally have lawer blood pressure and lawer rate of depression than those who don't own pets
75% of families who aquired pets reported an increase in the level of happiness and enjoyment in the homes

Today I could get up early and feel myself very fine 
I took a work in morning fresh air 
I really wonder why this dream remained as a dream for a long time
I should have gotten it a few years ago, if it can dramatically change my life
I should make a list of the other unfinished plans and unrealized dreams 
20 years in bed room
If I'm going to live till 60 years old, I will spend 20 years in my bed room, so I should spend more attention and money to make my bed room comfortable
This is my translation of the production by Kobo Abe ''The box man
He was one of the japanese avant-garde writers
Paking tape (waterproof) - about 2 m
I like the japanese common saying 雨垂石を穿つ that means constant dropping wears away the stone
I also like the sound of this saying 桃栗三年柿八年（ももくりさんねんかきはちねん）
It means that it takes three years to get peaches and eight years to get mons
But, as the japanese proverb says, time flies like an arrow （光陰矢のごとし）
I think if I make a constant effort, I can see a very good results soon
I feared taking mistakes in my wrinting, so did‘t write new diary these days
It‘s grammatically not correct to use a same word repeatedly in a text
So, for example, \"Japan\" has another name \"county of the rising sun\", or \"USA\" is sometimes called \"county of freedom
On the other hand, in English a word has lot of means
I feel English is very friendly language compared to Russian
Russian always frighten off foregin people with it‘s intricate grammer rules, heaviness of sounds and  many decorative expressions
It took almost ten years for me to like this language, although I like it very much now because it opened me the whole new world
The air is fresh and water is so clean
People live here looks so casual and relax
I will start my winter semester in Salzburg University majoring IC
Looking forward for my next six months
I will  show you fighting cats today
享受
Actually I am afraid of swine flu
But I also have the other point which make me eerie and frightened
